reviews.review_msg: Really well organized. Very accommodating, he extended the assignments in both classes I've had with him. Work load is high, and his grading is kinda tough, but usually fair. A great prof for both seminar and lecture!

Dr. McAllister is a really dynamic, interesting prof, esp in her smaller, senior classes. I did her intro 262 mega-class last yr & that was a waste of her talent. She is one of the top profs i've ever had - brilliant, with an international reputation. Like all newer profs, she's a bit uptight, but we call her Dr. M. and she relaxes.
Amateurish, nervous, disorganized. With the tuition costs we're paying, we deserve professional instruction - dump her.

Ya she's hot. SO put together. Articulate, inspiring, brilliant, hilarious.  The other day I went into her office and let the cat out of the bag about being stressed out about another course and she sat me down and gave me the best pep talk ever. Some teachers know how to set the bar high.

She's my prof in an upper div, seminar-type class, and I think she's doing a very good job.  I like her materials, they're reasonably challenging and useful for developing new perspectives.  She's also helpful and approachable; teaching style could be better, but overall, a good prof.
Stuart is incredible. His passion makes the lectures so entertaining and if you are willing, you can learn so much in his classes. Always has great TAs as well!
